meanings.definition: A small picture or map that is printed separately within a larger publication.
meanings.sent1: The magazine included an inset of a beautiful sunset on the back cover.
meanings.sent2: The textbook had an inset showing the world map on page 10.
meanings.sent3: The inset of a tiny cat in the newspaper made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like an inset of sparkling diamonds in her face.
meanings.sent5: The inset of a rainbow in the sky was a stunning addition to the painting.

meanings.sent1: She carefully inset the key into the lock and turned it.
meanings.sent2: Remember to inset the batteries correctly to make the toy work.
meanings.sent3: He tried to inset a square peg into a round hole, which didn't work well.
meanings.sent4: The idea inset itself into his mind like a puzzle piece fitting perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The artist decided to inset a small heart into the corner of the painting for a hidden detail.

meanings.definition: A piece of fabric that is sewn into a garment to add fullness or shape.
meanings.sent1: The dress had an inset of lace along the hem for a delicate touch.
meanings.sent2: The tailor added an inset of silk to the sleeve to create a flowing effect.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally sewed the inset upside down, creating a funny bulge.
meanings.sent4: The inset of velvet in the jacket made it look luxurious and elegant.
meanings.sent5: The inset of a floral pattern on the collar made the blouse stand out beautifully.
